bestBHT.bht: The writer rejoiced greatly upon the brethren coming and testifying of the truth in the intended audience. This truth is evident in the way they walk and encompasses every sphere of life. The audience's adherence to the truth contrasts with those like Diotrephes who do not. Despite the presence of false teachers, they remain steadfast and bring joy to the writer and faithful ministers. Their continuous adherence to the truth of the Gospel is a matter of great joy for all who truly love Christ.

bhtAttempts.bht: The writer of this verse expresses great joy upon hearing testimony about the truth that is in the intended audience. The use of testified suggests that this truth is evident in the way they live their lives. The commentator also highlights the contrast between those who walk in truth and those like Diotrephes who do not. The concept of truth in this verse encompasses various aspects of life. Despite the presence of false teachers, the audience remains steadfast in adhering to the truth. This brings joy not only to the writer but also to faithful ministers who delight in souls who embrace the truth and continue walking in it.
